sentences.english: This is how the CICM presence in Singapore started.
sentences.chinese: 这是如何开始在新加坡圣母圣心会的存在。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower at sunset from the Sacre-Coeur Basilica.
sentences.chinese: 在圣心大教堂上欣赏暮色中的埃菲尔铁塔。

sentences.english: Many of the most severely injured patients had been transported to Sacre Coeur.
sentences.chinese: 受伤最为严重的许多病人已被转至圣心医院治疗。

sentences.english: At Sheng Xin, we sometimes used the shuttlelecock to play adifferent game.
sentences.chinese: 在圣心，我们通常会用毽子来玩不同的游戏。

sentences.english: But this fact does not diminish the love for China of the CICM missionaries.
sentences.chinese: 但这一事实并不会削弱中国的圣母圣心会传教士的爱。

sentences.english: In fact, researches at Sacred Heart University devoted an entire study to this phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，圣心大学曾经专门研究过这种现象。

sentences.english: The Sacred Heart Catholic church (Basilique Sacré-Coeur) is seen on Paris' highest point, in Montmartre.
sentences.chinese: 蒙马特区的圣心殿是不雅鉴赏巴黎全景的最高点。

sentences.english: Basllique du Sacre Coeur was the last stop in the first day.
sentences.chinese: 圣心教堂是我们第一天的最后一站。

definition: enlightened sage/brilliant master (flattering words applied to ruler)
John/Saint John/less common variant of 約翰|约翰[Yue1 han4] preferred by the Catholic Church
Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
